ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I felt as if my research abilities dramatically improved over the past semester. I am so happy I was able to take an independent research class.

Because I worked in an immunobiology lab, I learned technical skills such as PCR, gel electrophoresis, Gibson assembly of vectors, sequence analysis, etc. But more importantly I learned how to conduct and analyze independent research, and succinctly write a paper that reflects a semester of hard work on a project that matters to me.

I gained so much from this course, both in terms of laboratory techniques in neurobiology, presenting research and understanding what working in a research lab is like. I learned to design and form my own hypotheses and think about the next steps of the project. Concretely, I developed skills in confocal microscopy, genetics (setting crosses, collecting virgins), mounting and dechorionating fly embryos and reading scientific papers.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Nothing to report! Thanks for pushing the final paper deadline back a few days.
Strengths: I thought the required research proposal and final report were very useful in helping organize my thoughts and insights for my project

I am very glad that such a course exists in the MCDB department to allow students to work in a real lab setting. I just wish that the grading were a letter grade instead of pass/fail, since it was a fairly demanding course for me both in terms of time and intellectual effort.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want to do research, especially if you want to start something and then build on it during the summer, do it!
If you are eager to work in a lab that you admire, definitely take this course and get credit for doing something you love!

You just work in a lab for 10-15 hours a week, pump out research, and write a final paper at the end. A great way to work on actual lab material, however DO NOT FORGET ABOUT THE FINAL PAPER. I did and it absolutely wrecked my finals period when I had to write 18-20 pages (mine was longer because I worked on two projects) in 4 days and as such pushed back all my other papers and studying.

I would really recommend this course to any student interested in working in an MCDB lab and learning to design a research project. I gained so much from this course, both in terms of laboratory techniques in neurobiology, presenting research and understanding what working in a research lab is like. To get a lot out of the course you must be willing to allocate 8 hours or more a week to research and to be challenged.
